headline: Oven-Roasted Turkey Breast
description: A turkey breast is roasted with a flavorful combination of butter and seasonings and served with homemade pan gravy in this easy, family-friendly recipe.
name: Oven-Roasted Turkey Breast
recipeIngredient: 0.5 teaspoon salt-free garlic and herb seasoning blend (such as Mrs. Dash®)
salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Mix together 1/4 cup butter, garlic, paprika, Italian seasoning, garlic and herb seasoning, salt, and black pepper in a bowl.

Place turkey breast with skin side up into a roasting pan. Loosen skin with your fingers; brush half the butter mixture over the turkey breast and underneath the skin. Reserve remaining butter mixture. Tent turkey breast loosely with aluminum foil.

Roast in the preheated oven for 1 hour; baste turkey breast with remaining butter mixture. Return to oven and roast until the juices run clear and an instant-read meat thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the breast, not touching bone, reads 165 degrees F (65 degrees C), about 30 more minutes. Let turkey breast rest 10 to 15 minutes before serving.

While turkey is resting, transfer pan drippings to a skillet. Skim off excess grease, leaving about 1 tablespoon in skillet. Place skillet over low heat; cook and stir shallot in turkey grease until opaque, about 5 minutes.

Melt 1 tablespoon butter in skillet with shallot and whisk in white wine, scraping any browned bits of food from skillet. Whisk in chicken stock and flour until smooth. Bring to a simmer, whisking constantly, until thickened. For a creamier, lighter gravy, whisk in half-and-half.

review.reviewBody: Been cooking these for 50 years This spot on ! Add your bulk veggies under rack for stock with A sprig of rosemary & you will have the the best ever !
I made this exactly as the recipe says. The turkey breast was amazing, so moist and full of flavour. The gravy incredible! Will definitely be making it again. Thank you!
Cooked a 6lb turkey 🦃 breast bone in upside down and breast was so juiced and soaked in broth. Absolutely my new way. UPSIDE-DOWN 🙃
I want to use this recipe for Thanksgiving for 2022 because I only have a raw turkey breast but no dry wine but only chicken stock
This recipe is great. I didn’t use all the seasonings but it cooked perfectly!
Followed the recipe as is. Delicious!
Yes I added a few spices that I prefer.
Perfect directions. Gravy was superb with a little Worcestershire sauce & paprika added. Will definitely use this recipe again :)
Loved it the way it was written. I used spicy Italian seasoning and it was superb! Perfect on a chilly winters night.
I followed the directions how they read and it was perfect. I would definitely make it again
used the packaging 325 temp instead, but otherwise kept it the same

I made it as written and it was fantastic. My grandson had just had Thanksgiving the day before with an Uncle and he said that my turkey was the best he ever had. Great compliment from someone who always says "its alright."
Perfection. Tender, all that others have reported.
Perfect in every way! Turned out moist and an appetizing medium golden brown color.
Moist, tasty, easy
The turkey breast was full of flavor and tender! Easy recipe!
I wish we would have done this for Christmas dinner instead of the entire bird! Clean-up was a breeze. I subbed smoked paprika for regular paprika and it was delicious.

Very good. I brought the cooking time down because my turkey breast was only 1.5 lbs, and it didn't have the skin, so I poked holes in the surface with a toothpick and brushed the butter, seasonings, and garlic on with that. The temperature was perfect, and the combination of seasonings really worked with the turkey.
We made this for Thanksgiving and it was delicious! My picky eaters declared it the best turkey they’ve ever had. Super moist, flavorful, and easy. We will make this recipe every time we do turkey!
Fabulous! I skipped the gravy because I do not love gravy. It was moist and delicious and was able to enjoy if for lunch with a salad. Stayed moist for days in the fridge.

this was about the best turkey I've ever made. I did cook it in a roasting bag. I didn't have shallots and used onions instead. It was full of flavor and moist. I had to add a jar of store bought gravy to make more and it was good. I certainly will make this again.

This was the most delicious turkey I have ever made in my life! I will admit, I didn't make it exact, but only because I didn't have Mrs. Dash or Italian seasoning. But I had most of the herbs that go into Italian seasoning and the minced garlic. I did a tsp each of all the herbs. The thyme and rosemary were fresh. Kerrygold butter. I didn't have a roasting pan, used baking dish. I didn't use any tin foil. It was still the juiciest, most delicious turkey ever! I didn't make the gravy, but I bet it would've be delicious if I had. My husband says its the best and he's excited to take some to work tomorrow. Thank you so much for sharing this! This will be how I cook turkey from here on out!

My husband and I don't cook as often as we'd like to. This recipe was perfect and simple enough for even us! I'm so proud! This was our first ever attempt at turkey for Thanksgiving and we had everything we needed already on hand. Thank you so much

Great recipe that looked beautiful and tasted great. Made the gravy and it was excellent, though I put a little more wine in the gravy so lost the turkey flavor in it. The recipe kept the Turkey moist and browned beautifully! This is a keeper! I made it with carrots, celery and onion under the breast.
I used the idea AllRecipe had on the bacon roasted Turkey recipe and added the bacon on top of the Turkey breast and it brought a new level of tasted to an otherwise boring piece of meat.
moist, delicious, and flavorful throughout. will make again.

Tried this simple recipe for the 1st time. Delicious. Clear instructions, a reasonable amount of spices & a no fuss recipe frees you up to multi-task. Enjoyed it hot for dinner & will enjoy tasty sandwiches tomorrow and chopped turkey over salad with craisins & walnuts through the week.

This was a flavorful turkey breast recipe. I loved the combination of spices. 
I skipped making the gravy (we're trying to cut back!) but I will definitely make it again.

The turkey turned out great! It was moist and easy to slice. My picky brother who thinks he’s the best cook ate 2 helpings. I actually lined my roasting rack with onion and celery for more flavor. Also, I didn’t care for the gravy so I ended using a mushroom gravy instead. 

Next time I’ll substitute olive oil to cut some fat.
Great recipe! I used a boneless turkey breast, Cooked it uncovered for just 1 hour, used all the drippings for the gravy I just added Tony’s seasoning to make it a little spicy.

I doubled the butter rub, since my bone-in turkey breast was nearly 7 pounds. I basted 3 times over the nearly 3 hours in was in the oven. I never did tent it, but would have if it seemed to need it (it didn't). Crisp, delicious skin! I didn't do the gravy, because the turkey came with a gravy packet, but I did put about 3 tablespoons of pan drippings into the simmering gravy. Really, really good! Definitely a keeper.
Fabulous! Just make sure not too over cook. That last 30 minutes may be too much depending on your oven.
I really enjoyed this! My turkey breast smelled like stuffing but it didn't taste like it. Was moist and delicious. I didn't make the gravy so I can't rate that.
Turned out great! Yes, I will make this again.

This is the first time I've made a non-Butterball turkey breast. I got a 3.5 pounds fresh turkey breast bone-in. It took 1.5 hours, the first hour at 350 with tented foil, the last 30 min at 400 no foil. It came out incredibly juicy and delicious, and a gorgeous colour. Husband said it was the best turkey he had ever had in his life. Every plate was wiped clean, something never seen on our picky house!! I was so proud! And it wasn't even hard!
This is an excellent recipe. The turkey was very tasty and moist. Will definitely do again.
very easy and delish. i had a 5.5 lb breast and baked for 2.5 hours basting twice. gravy was amazing addition.
Delicious and simple recipe. I cooked the turkey breast in a standard roasting pan. It was very tender and I was able to use the remaining portions in a pasta dish. I would recommend this recipe.

Roasted in a big ole cast iron skillet and raised temp to 400 for the last 30 minutes. Added approx a 1/4 cup of chicken broth to pan after taking foil off. 
Was perfectly browned and delicious. Gravy was easy to make and was soooo yummy! Will definitely make again!
I doubled the recipe for a 6.9 lb turkey for our family of 6. It was so moist and the gravy flavorful. The kids and my husband all loved it and had seconds!
This turned out so flavorful and moist! Prepared just as written.
This recipe is incredible! Not hard to do at all, and so tasty! I've made it several times, and it always comes out so good! You won't regret this one!
Easy to make, nice and moist. Would have liked the skin to be more crisp, but it was very good.
We loved it. Will do again.
Followed the recipe exactly -- it turned out great! The turkey was very moist.
Followed the recipe exactly- SO good!!! Got tons of compliments.

I will definitely use this easy recipe again. My turkey breast was juicy n filled with flavor. I did leave out the wine as I didn't have any on hand but otherwise I pretty much followed the recipe tho I didn't have fresh parsley so I used the flaked parsley seasoning. I just loved the gravy packet for my husbsnd raved over how tastey it was n the right consistency too! Sorry no pic for it was sooooo good that it got ate before I had time to take a photo. The leftovers were great for sandwiches for the next few days!!!
Susan-TX
Had to extend the cooking time, but the turkey was good
This is a great recipe I used time bake in a convection oven. Turned it down to 275 for 5 lbs turkey breast for from start to finish 2.5 hours so juicy.

This was phenomenal. Increased seasonings by half for a 7 lb breast to keep the flavors “light” for the little ones. Used smoked paprika and a rotisserie chicken seasoning for the garlic herb blend because that’s what I had. Subbed a mix of garlic and onion for the shallot for the same reason. I can’t say enough about this recipe. Husband and daughter had seconds and the grandchildren cleaned their plates. Had to thin out the remaining gravy with some broth to extend the gravy to have with leftovers. Yes, it was that good. This is a new favorite!
This was simple to make and so tender. I will definitely make this again.

First time making just a turkey breast for my Hubby and me. Made it exactly like the recipe (always have Mrs. Dash on hand, just added a little extra Italian seasoning for our personal tastes )...SO tasty and juicy...definitely not dry. Made the gravy, too...again, very tasty. Will make again!
Love this recipe
Ots delicious!!! And not dry at all
Delicious! Great flavor, not at all dry. Would definitely make this again.
Best turkey ever! My husband said this recipe is a definite keeper. Nice and juicy.

It was all right. Nothing to write home about. Overall, it was kind of plain. I was surprised, because it is rated so high, but ultimately, beyond the basic turkey flavor, there was but much more beyond that.
This was good and I will definitely make again. I did use a larger breast than 3 lb and I believe I over-cooked as it was somewhat dry.
Best Turkey breast i have ever made!

As I suspected, adding the flour to the gravy as described led to clumps of raw flour throughout. You are better off making a roux with the butter/turkey grease first then adding in wine (I was much more generous than a splash) followed by the broth or stock. The taste of the gravy was however very good. I boosted the flavor by adding in some of the baste mix (that had not touched the raw turkey) to deepen the color and make for a complex gravy taste. The turkey was quite delicious with these seasonings.
Juicy and flavorful! The drippings made a unique, orange colored gravy, perfect for the stuffing, potatoes and turkey.
Very tasty and super easy!
Super easy and delicious.

The turkey breast came out moist and tender, but there was less than one tablespoon of drippings, not nearly enough to make gravy. Luckily I had some packaged gravy on hand. I made this for Thanksgiving dinner, being alone this year I used a !/2 fresh turkey breast, not a full one. I'd make it this way again.
Yes, I will make this again!!! I did make some changes due to my dietary restrictions. Which consist of no salt and using Mrs. Dash instead :)
This is now my go to recipe for bone-in turkey breast. It is amazing how juicy and tender the meat is. Just wish the skin would be crispier.
Added thyme, rosemary, sage and more garlic. Very moist and short cooking time. Will definitely make again.

My turkey breast is in the first part of cooking now. I am writing to ask for hints on how to actually get the seasoned butter to STICK to the turkey breast skin. Not sure if my bird or my hands were too cold but all I succeeded in accomplishing was to get the seasoned butter all over every single finger, my mini spatula and numerous paper towels as well as my microwave door and controls when I finally decided to melt the butter slightly so I could brush it on. I made a second batch of the butter.. will "baste" with it in 20 mins. This is a trial run for our Thanksgiving dinner. in two weeks so I really want to get this right. I am using a 7.4 lbs breast and doubled ingredients (for each batch of butter spread I made) THANKS for any TIPs anyone can provide. jgcorpex4@yahoo.com
Definitely will make it again!
Simply and very tasty.
Fantastic
I made it pretty much to the recipe but was missing shallots and white wine. Turkey was very moist and the drippings made a very flavorful gravy .
Very easy to make. It was flavorful and a moist. I will be making this again. I wouldn't change a thing.

Followed directions then lowered to 325 til the thermometer indicated 170 and the temperature indicator poped. About 40 more minutes. I forgot the wine for the gravy so I drank it with the meal. I did not have shallot so used onions. Gravy was better on baked potatoes than on turkey. It seemed like a lot of work. Possibly because of all the pans, bowls, dishes, utensils I used. Turkey is always work for me but tastes good. If it had been a whole bird I would have used a Reynolds turkey bag.
I didn't make the gravy. But the turkey was very moist and full of flavour. Will definitely make again. My husband said "lets' buy turkey breasts all the time".
We didn’t use any salt and the flavor was fantastic!! A new addition to the family favorites.

Definitely 5 stars as well as something you can make year round … essentially followed recipe adding a little more chardonnay, roasted garlic and homemade “mojo” … Major crowd pleaser. Outstanding pan juices for the gravy!
Very easy to make and tasty. Keeps the turkey breast moist.
It turned out great. It was easy to make.

The recipe was great, but a little more involved than it needed to be. Previously I have done turkey breasts by seasoning with salt, Pepper and other basic seasonings along with a rub of olive oil and butter. Those turkey breast have turned out pretty much the same as this more involved recipe
The flavor was amazing! The leftovers were used in sandwiches and salads. Thank you!
This turkey is moist and has so much flavor. The gravy is outstanding I added the half and half, it gave it just the right amount of creaminess. I will definitely be making this again!!
It was great! Very flavorful, quick and easy. Will definitely make it again.

This is a delicious & easy recipe! It's wonderful as is, which is how I make it for my family. I have easily modified it when hosting dinners where some attending is gluten & dairy free and it was just as delicious.
best turkey breast ever! And the gravy was awesome also!

This was wonderful. I had a 8.5 lb bone in turkey breast so I doubled the other ingredients but used less butter to cut some fat. I baked it in my cast iron dutch oven with the lid slightly vented. It turned out delicious. This is one of our new favorites.
I cooked the turkey breast on a layer of thinly sliced onions. Delicious!

This is some of the best turkey we have ever eaten! Easy to prep and cook. Simple ingredients. Great taste. Really enjoyed the turkey. The gravy was spot on. Great recipe. Thanks for sharing. We will use the recipe often.
3.5 Stars - only because my 7.5 lb turkey breast was done in less than 3 hours which put me at a disadvantage since none of my side dishes were ready. Still very tasty and moist.
My boneless breast was 7.25lbs so i doubled all the ingredients cooked in oven for 2.5hr or until temp was 170. Turned out great will make again!
Great recipe and easy to make!! I baked 7 lb breast for 2 1/2 hrs covered and 1/2 hr uncovered

Cooking time was perfect. Didn't use salt substitute as they are bad for people with kidney disease. Also mad our own usual gravy with drippings, chicken stock, corn starch, Worcestershire, and black pepper.

So great! Easy to make with loads of flavour. I reserved about half of the au jus for the next night, thickened it with some corn starch and made hot turkey sandwiches. Most amazing turkey sandwich. I will definitely make this again.
Easy to follow. Came out moist and delicious.

De-lish! I made a 4#11oz turkey breast (1/2 breast) with wing on. While I did not measure the exact ingredients, the flavour was incredibly good. I did rub the seasoned butter under the skin and over the entire top and loosely covered with foil. After 30 minutes, I added a couple of spoonfuls of the season butter over the top and then poured over 1/4 cup straight orange juice, retented with the foil and back into the oven. After the second 30 minutes, I did the same thing but left the the turkey breast UNcovered for the rest of the cooking time. I repeated the butter mixture followed by 1/4-1/2 cup of orange juice one last time. Total time roasting was 90 minutes which was perfect. As for the gravy, I prefer 'au jus', no thickening agents at all, adjusted the seasoning and reduced slightly on the stove top.
I loved the flavour of the seasoned butter with the orange juice, which was a very slight flavour and did not overwhelm at all.
perfect!

Made the turkey breast exactly as instructed and it turned out fantastic! The best turkey breast I've had that wasn't brined! I used turkey fat instead of butter for the gravy and I added the 3 tbspns of flour directly to the pan once the onions were translucent, creating a roux before adding in the turkey broth (which is subbed for the chicken broth). I added some salt to taste after the gravy was off the pan, which turned out just fine. Next time I'll add the salt and pepper to the pan after I add the broth. Overall an excellent recipe!

The family loved it. Had a 7lb breast and used a Thermapen for cooking accuracy. Took three hours to cook and basted with the leftover butter mixture allowing for it to be Beautifully browned and everyone commented on the flavor and how tender it was. Unlike most cooks I went totally by the recipe but did not make the gravy. Definitely recommend
Easy and delicious I would definitely make this again
